meanings.definition: The process of producing a genetically identical organism from an existing organism.
meanings.sent1: Scientists used cloning to make an exact copy of the sheep.
meanings.sent2: The cloning of plants has helped in preserving endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The cloning of the cake recipe made everyone happy at the party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, trends often undergo a form of cloning.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cloning can be both fascinating and controversial.

meanings.definition: To create a copy or duplicate of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to start cloning her favorite book for her friends.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to begin cloning their successful product next year.
meanings.sent3: Cloning her dance moves made the performance even more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His ability to clone his handwriting amazed his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work seemed to clone the beauty of nature itself.
